results.title: Make-up
results.creator_credit: Lawrie Lawler and Centre for Educational Television Overseas Training Films
results.brief_description: Considers the basic rules of make-up, which apply to black and white television production. Demonstrates cleansing, applying the foundation, shading, lighting and powdering. The special treatment of the eyes, lips, hair and hands are shown. Demonstrated by Laura Bradish.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lawrie Lawler and Centre for Educational Television Overseas Training Films

results.title: Maisy's farm
results.creator_credit: Leo Nielsen, Clive Juster, King Rollo Films and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Discover all the work that has to be done around the farm for each of the year’s four seasons as Maisy and her friends, Tallulah, Charley, Cyril and Eddie, have fun while they work. Other adventures see them climbing a mountain, going on a train journey, shopping, finding out about bugs, a duckling and even about breakfast! DVD contains sixteen sing-a-long songs that toddlers will just love and also five interactive games. Simple animation with bold, primary colours makes Maisy very appealing to the 0 to 4 year age group. Sounds and voices provided by Australia’s Umbilical Brothers. Based on books by Lucy Cousins, narrated by Neil Morrissey. Comes with Instruction booklet.

results.title: Mais ou et donc ornicar
results.creator_credit: Bertrand van Effenterre and Mallia Films
results.brief_description: Two women decide to alter the course of their lives by seeking new paths away from the roles traditionally ascribed to them by society. One, Isabelle (Geraldine Chaplin), begins directing a video production unit for sociological research into the life experiences and opinions of a broad array of women; the other, Anne (Brigitte Fossey), becomes a successful garage mechanic and foreman despite the challenges of being taken seriously by customers and co-workers. Both women face challenges inherent within their chosen fields, but also encounter difficulties achieving a work and family life balance, becoming acutely aware of the needs of their children/lovers/ husbands. These scenarios act as a means for director Bertrand van Effenterre to examine the complexities inherent within communication between the sexes and the tribulations of relationships for women, but also for men facing female emancipation. The narrative, brimming with intriguing and humorous insights into the plights faced by women struggling to discover ways in which they might find their identity and even happiness, is bolstered by strong key performances. Also stars: Jean-Francois Stevenin, Didier Flamand, Jean-Jacques Biraud and Claire Denis.

results.title: Maintenance and sharpening of power saw chains
results.brief_description: Unsatisfactory performance and service of power saw chains is usually due to inadequate maintenance. Shows three basic rules for maintenance: check chain tension; check oiling system and use only correct oil; regularly “touch up” chain cutting teeth with file without removing from saw.

results.title: Maintaining the catch
results.brief_description: Intended to show fishermen the significance of biological research on crayfish populations in Western Australian waters. Animation is used to explain why the industry should restrict their catch and improve their livelihood at the same time. Emphasises the need for cooperation between scientists and fishermen.

results.title: Mainstreaming in action (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Grania Gurievitch, Ellen Barnes, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Togg Films
results.brief_description: Shows several elementary and secondary classrooms in public schools as teachers work with disabled students as part of regular classroom sessions. Discusses solutions to problems teachers may encounter, the practicality of mainstreaming, what it means, and how it affects teachers and students. Suitable for teacher/tertiary levels.

results.title: Mainly monkeys. Koalas and co
results.creator_credit: Louise Jonas, Rob McCubbin and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Contains two programmes filmed at Melbourne Zoo. 1.”Mainly monkeys” shows the social behaviour of groups of monkeys and other primates that live in trees. 2.”Koalas and Co.” observes some Australian animals adapted for life in trees, such as koalas, fruit bats, tree frogs and lizards. Both programmes are non-narrated, making use of natural sound.

results.title: Mainly monkeys
results.creator_credit: Rob McCubbin, Louise Jonas and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Filmed in close detail at the Royal Melbourne Zoological Gardens, the Sir Colin Mackenzie Fauna Park, Healesville and the Royal Botanic Gardens, Melbourne, with minimal evidence of enclosures. Shows groups of monkeys and other primates living in trees, their feeding and grooming habits, their method of communication and care of the young. Adapted from “A Zoo in the trees”. Non-narrated using natural sound. Suitable for middle and upper pprimary levels.
